definition: to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
to fan/to slap sb on the face
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: They propel themselves by using a small fin on their back that flutters up to 35 times per second.
sentences.chinese: 它们靠背上每秒钟扇动达35次的小鳍来推动自己。

sentences.english: A ladybug in flight beats its wings up to 85 times per second.
sentences.chinese: 瓢虫飞行时每秒钟扇动翅膀85次。

sentences.english: shaded and fanned by the gorgeous wings of a beautiful Butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 一只美丽的蝴蝶用它色彩斑斓的翅膀在蚂蚁头上扇动。

sentences.english: Is every bird flapping its wings at the exact same frequency?
sentences.chinese: 每只鸟会以同样的频率扇动翅膀吗？

sentences.english: She dried her wings and fluttered down to look for him.
sentences.chinese: 她晾干翅膀扇动着双翅飞下去找他。

sentences.english: When flapped, wind would issue from it, and the "wind wrapped in paper" could thus be carried to the old man.
sentences.chinese: 扇动的时候会产生风，可以带给老人“纸里的风”。

sentences.english: He oxygenates the eggs by fanning them with his pectoral fins.
sentences.chinese: 他以扇动胸鳍的方式来为受精卵供氧。

definition: to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
